docs.title: KogamaLuaAPI Documentation
docs.text: Complete Lua scripting documentation for KogamaLuaAPI v0.4-alpha — A powerful mod that lets you automate and control everything in KoGaMa with code.

docs.title: What You Can Do
docs.text:
• Create & manipulate cubes — Shape your world programmatically
  • Spawn game objects — Place interactive elements with code
  • Automate building tasks — Script complex operations
  • Store & manage data — Session-based persistent storage
  • Control the camera — Programmatic view control
  • Handle game events — Respond to in-game actions

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Start with the Getting Started guide to write your first script in minutes.

-- Your first script: scripts/hello.lua
local cube = new_cube()
cube.position = {0, 0, 0}
cube.materials[1] = 2  -- Red
cube:spawn()

print("Cube created!")

Load it in-game with: /loadscript hello

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: • Getting Started Guide — Setup, examples, and troubleshooting

docs.title: Core APIs
docs.text:
• Cubes — Create, retrieve, and modify cubes
  • Properties — Position, materials, deformation
  • Objects — Spawn and link game objects
  • Text Properties — Text object settings

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Camera — Control camera position and rotation
  • File System — Load and manage script files
  • Event Handlers — Listen to game events
  • Session Storage — Persistent temporary data

docs.title: Reference
docs.text:
• Materials Reference — All 70+ material IDs with previews
  • Object Types Reference — 80+ spawnable objects with images

docs.title: Community & Support
docs.text:
• Discord Community — Get help, share scripts, report bugs
  • GitHub Repository — Source code and releases
  • Latest Release — Download the mod

docs.title: Need Help?
docs.text:
• Check the Getting Started guide
  • Use the search bar (top-right)
  • Ask on Discord
  • Report issues on GitHub

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Quick guide to start scripting with KogamaLuaAPI.

docs.title: Scripts Folder
docs.text:
Your scripts go in:

%localappdata%/KogamaLuaAPI/scripts/

The folder auto-creates on first run. You can create subfolders to organize your scripts.

docs.title: Loading Scripts
docs.text:
In-game chat, type:

/loadscript test
/loadscript myfolder/script

!!! note "Extension" Don't include .lua extension — the mod adds it automatically.

docs.title: Auto-Load
docs.text: Name your script init.lua and place it in scripts/ to auto-load when you join a game.

docs.title: Your First Script
docs.text:
Create scripts/hello.lua:

print("Hello Kogama!")

local cube = new_cube()
cube.position = {0, 0, 0}
cube.materials[1] = 2  -- Red
cube:spawn()

print("Cube created!")

Load it in-game:

/loadscript hello

You should see messages in chat and a red cube appear at position 0,0,0.

docs.title: Create Multiple Cubes
docs.text:
Build structures by looping:

for i = 0, 10 do
    local cube = new_cube()
    cube.position = {i, 0, 0}
    cube.materials[1] = 5  -- Yellow
    cube:spawn()
end

docs.title: Color a Structure
docs.text:
Apply different materials to each face:

local cube = new_cube()
cube.position = {0, 5, 0}
cube.materials[1] = 1   -- Top: Red
cube.materials[2] = 2   -- Bottom: Dark Red
cube.materials[3] = 34  -- Front: Blue
cube.materials[4] = 35  -- Back: Dark Blue
cube:spawn()

See Materials Reference for all available colors.

docs.title: Create a Text Object
docs.text:
Spawn text in your world:

local text = new_object(OBJECTS.TEXT)
text.position = {0, 5, 0}
text.text = "Hello World!"
text.scale = 2
text:spawn()

docs.title: Build a Line of Cubes
docs.text:
function build_line(start, end_pos, material)
    for i = start, end_pos do
        local cube = new_cube()
        cube.position = {i, 0, 0}
        cube.materials[1] = material
        cube:spawn()
    end
end

build_line(0, 20, 10)  -- Build line from 0 to 20 with material 10

docs.title: Modify Existing Cubes
docs.text:
Get and change cube properties:

local cube = get_cube({5, 10, 3})
if cube then
    cube.materials[1] = 45
    cube:spawn()  -- Apply changes
    print("Cube updated!")
end

docs.title: Use :spawn() After Changes
docs.text:
Always call :spawn() after modifying cube properties:

local cube = new_cube()
cube.position = {0, 0, 0}
cube.materials[1] = 5
cube:spawn()  -- Required!

docs.title: Use init.lua for Auto-Loading
docs.text:
Create %localappdata%/KogamaLuaAPI/scripts/init.lua to auto-load on game start:

print("Game started! Running initialization...")
-- Your startup code here

docs.title: Read Error Messages
docs.text:
Errors appear in game chat. Always read the full error message — it tells you:

  • Where the error is (line number)
  • What went wrong
  • How to fix it

docs.title: Debugging
docs.text:
If something doesn't work:

  1. Check the error in chat — Read the full error message carefully
  2. Verify file location — Must be in %localappdata%/KogamaLuaAPI/scripts/
  3. Check spelling — Lua is case-sensitive (new_cube ≠ newCube)
  4. Use print() — Debug your script with print() statements
  5. Test in isolation — Create a simple test script to isolate issues

docs.title: Common Errors
docs.text:
Error: Unknown global variable

  • Check variable names are spelled correctly
  • Make sure you declared the variable with local or =

Cube doesn't appear

  • Did you call :spawn()?
  • Is the position valid for the current model?

Script doesn't load

  • Check file path is correct
  • Use /loadscript filename (without .lua)
  • Reload the page or rejoin the game

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• API Reference — Complete function reference
  • Cube API — Master cube manipulation
  • Objects API — Spawn interactive objects
  • Materials Reference — All available colors

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
Have questions or want to share your scripts?

  • Discord Server — Active community, get help, showcase projects
  • GitHub Issues — Report bugs or suggest features

docs.title: Camera
docs.text: Control the camera view and movement.

docs.title: camera.mode
docs.text:
Sets the camera control mode.

Values: - "default" - Standard camera mode - "free" - Free camera mode with manual control

Example: 

camera.mode = "free"

docs.title: camera.move_speed
docs.text:
Sets the movement speed in free camera mode.

Type: number

Example: 

camera.mode = "free"
camera.move_speed = 10

docs.title: camera.look_speed
docs.text:
Sets the look/rotation speed in free camera mode.

Type: number

Example: 

camera.mode = "free"
camera.look_speed = 5

docs.title: See Also
docs.text: • Getting Started - Scripting basics

docs.title: Event Handlers
docs.text: React to game events with callbacks.

docs.title: on_cube_removed(callback)
docs.text:
Registers a callback function that triggers when a cube is removed from the world.

Parameters: - callback (function) - Function called when a cube is removed - Receives cube (object) - The removed cube object as parameter

Returns: None

Example: 

on_cube_removed(function(cube)
    print("Cube removed at position: " .. cube.x .. ", " .. cube.y .. ", " .. cube.z)
end)

docs.title: on_command(command, callback)
docs.text:
Registers a callback function that triggers when a specific command is entered.

Parameters: - command (string) - The command name to listen for - callback (function) - Function called when the command is executed - Receives args (table) - Arguments passed with the command

Returns: None

Example: 

on_command("hello", function(args)
    print("Hello command executed!")
    if args[1] then
        print("First argument: " .. args[1])
    end
end)

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• Cubes API - Cube manipulation
  • Getting Started - Scripting basics

docs.title: File System
docs.text: Access files and resources from your scripts folder.

docs.title: require(path)
docs.text:
Loads and executes a Lua script from the scripts folder.

Parameters: - path (string) - Script path relative to scripts/ folder, use / for subdirectories

Returns: Depends on what the loaded script returns

Example: 

require("config")
require("mods/builder")

docs.title: read_file(filename)
docs.text:
Reads entire text file as string.

Parameters: - filename (string) - File path relative to scripts/ folder

Returns: - File content (string) on success - nil on error (file not found, etc.)

docs.title: read_image(filename)
docs.text:
Loads image file and provides access to pixel data.

Parameters: - filename (string) - Image file path relative to scripts/ folder - Supported formats: .png, .jpg, .jpeg, .bmp, .gif

Returns: - Image object with properties: - width (number) - Image width in pixels - height (number) - Image height in pixels - pixels[y][x] - 2D array of pixels (1-indexed) - Each pixel has: .r, .g, .b, .a (0-255 values) - nil on error

docs.title: Scripts Folder Location
docs.text:
All paths are relative to your scripts folder:

%localappdata%/KogamaLuaAPI/scripts/

Examples: - config.lua → %localappdata%/KogamaLuaAPI/scripts/config.lua - mods/builder.lua → %localappdata%/KogamaLuaAPI/scripts/mods/builder.lua

docs.title: See Also
docs.text: • Getting Started - Script loading and auto-load

docs.title: Session Storage
docs.text: Store data temporarily during your game session.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The session table provides temporary data storage that persists as long as you're in the game. All data is reset when you close the game.

Important: Session data is not saved to disk - it's only available while playing.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
session.my_value = 42
session.my_string = "Hello"

docs.title: See Also
docs.text: • Getting Started - Scripting basics

docs.title: Cubes
docs.text: Complete guide to cube manipulation in Kogama Lua API.

docs.title: new_cube([id])
docs.text:
Creates a new cube and returns a cube object for manipulation.

Parameters: - id (optional, number) - Model ID. If omitted, the cube is added to the currently edited model.

Returns: Cube object

Important: After setting all properties, you must call :spawn() to actually add the cube to the world.

Example: 

local cube = new_cube()
cube.position = {0, 0, 0}
cube.materials[1] = 1
cube:spawn()  -- Required - finalizes cube creation

docs.title: get_cube(position)
docs.text:
Returns the cube at the specified position or nil if not found.

Example: 

local cube = get_cube({5, 10, 3})
if cube then
    print("Cube found!")
end

docs.title: get_cubes([id])
docs.text:
Returns all cubes from a model. If id is omitted, returns cubes from the currently edited model.

Example: 

local cubes = get_cubes()
for i, cube in ipairs(cubes) do
    print("Cube at:", cube.position[1], cube.position[2], cube.position[3])
end

docs.title: remove_cube(position)
docs.text:
Removes the cube at the specified position.

Returns: - true - Cube was removed - false - No cube at position - nil - Error occurred

Example: 

if remove_cube({0, 0, 0}) then
    print("Cube removed!")
end

docs.title: position
docs.text:
Position as {x, y, z} (integer coordinates). 

cube.position = {5, 10, 3}
cube:spawn()

docs.title: materials[1-6]
docs.text:
Material ID for each individual face of the cube (1-6, where each number corresponds to a different face). 

cube.materials[1] = 1  -- Top face: Bright Red
cube.materials[2] = 2  -- Bottom face: Red
cube:spawn()

📖 Learn more about materials →

docs.title: corners[1-8]
docs.text:
Vertex positions for cube deformation. Each corner is {x, y, z} with values 0-4 (integers). 

cube.corners[1] = {0, 4, 0}  -- Default: top-left-front
cube.corners[1] = {0, 4, 2}  -- Deform upward
cube:spawn()

📖 Learn more about corners →

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• Cube Properties - Detailed reference for position, materials, and corners
  • Materials Reference - All material IDs with previews

docs.title: Face Indices
docs.text:
Each cube has 6 faces corresponding to coordinate axes:

Index Axis Direction 1 +Y Top 2 -Y Bottom 3 -Z Front 4 +Z Back 5 -X Left 6 +X Right

Example: 

cube.materials[1] = 11  -- Top: Bright Green
cube.materials[2] = 13  -- Bottom: Dark Green
cube.materials[3] = 6   -- Front: Bright Blue
cube.materials[4] = 8   -- Back: Dark Blue
cube.materials[5] = 1   -- Left: Bright Red
cube.materials[6] = 3   -- Right: Dark Red

docs.title: Material IDs
docs.text:
Material IDs range from 1 to 69.

Default material: ID 22 (Concrete) - Used when invalid ID is provided - Used when player doesn't own the material

See Materials Reference for complete list with previews.

docs.title: Corners
docs.text: Vertex manipulation for cube deformation.

docs.title: Corner Indices
docs.text:
Each cube has 8 vertices (corners), indexed 1-8, in a local 5×5×5 space.

Value range: x, y, z must be integers from 0 to 4

docs.title: Default State (Undeformed Cube)
docs.text:
cube.corners[1] = {0, 4, 0}  -- Left-Top-Front
cube.corners[2] = {0, 4, 4}  -- Left-Top-Back
cube.corners[3] = {4, 4, 4}  -- Right-Top-Back
cube.corners[4] = {4, 4, 0}  -- Right-Top-Front
cube.corners[5] = {4, 0, 0}  -- Right-Bottom-Front
cube.corners[6] = {4, 0, 4}  -- Right-Bottom-Back
cube.corners[7] = {0, 0, 4}  -- Left-Bottom-Back
cube.corners[8] = {0, 0, 0}  -- Left-Bottom-Front

⚠️ Note: There is no reset function - you must manually set corners to default values.

docs.title: Objects
docs.text: Complete guide to object manipulation in Kogama Lua API.

docs.title: new_object(type)
docs.text:
Creates a new game object and returns an object instance.

Parameters: - type (number) - Object type enum (e.g., OBJECTS.TEXT, OBJECTS.BAZOOKA)

Returns: Object or nil on error

Important: Position must be set immediately after creation and cannot be changed later.

Example: 

local obj = new_object(OBJECTS.TEXT)
obj.position = {0, 5, 0}
obj:spawn()

docs.title: link(obj1, obj2)
docs.text:
Links obj1 output to obj2 input.

Example: 

link(obj1, obj2)

docs.title: See Also
docs.text: • Object Types Reference - Complete list of spawnable objects

docs.title: Text Object Properties
docs.text: Properties for OBJECTS.TEXT objects.

docs.title: obj.text
docs.text:
Sets the displayed text content.

Type: string

docs.title: obj.color
docs.text:
Sets the text color using RGB values.

Type: table {r, g, b} - Values 0-1

docs.title: obj.size
docs.text:
Sets the text size.

Type: number

docs.title: obj.billboard
docs.text:
Controls whether the text always faces the camera.

Type: boolean

docs.title: Example
docs.text:
local textObj = new_object(OBJECTS.TEXT)
textObj.position = {0, 5, 0}
textObj.text = "Hello World!"
textObj.color = {1, 0, 0}
textObj.size = 2.5
textObj.billboard = true
textObj:spawn()

docs.title: See Also
docs.text:
• Objects API - Object creation
  • Object Types Reference - All object types

docs.title: Materials Reference
docs.text:
Complete list of all 70 material IDs for cube faces. Assign these to cube.materials[1-6] for each face.

cube.materials[1] = 2    -- Red
cube.materials[2] = 12   -- Green
cube:spawn()

Based on Kogama Wiki - Materials.

!!! tip "Search" Use Ctrl+F (or Cmd+F on Mac) to quickly find a material by name or ID.

Icon Name ID BRIGHT_RED 1 RED 2 DARK_RED 3 SAND 4 LIGHT_PURPLE_FABRIC 5 BRIGHT_BLUE 6 BLUE 7 DARK_BLUE 8 CARAMEL 9 PURPLE_FABRIC 10 BRIGHT_GREEN 11 GREEN 12 DARK_GREEN 13 CERAMIC 14 DARK_PURPLE_FABRIC 15 YELLOW 16 BRIGHT_ORANGE 17 ORANGE 18 BUTTER 19 SANDSTONE 20 LIGHT_CONCRETE 21 CONCRETE 22 DARK_CONCRETE 23 BLACK_CONCRETE 24 KHAKI 25 ICE 26 LAVA 27 BOUNCY 28 POISON 29 PARKOUR 30 BRICKS 31 BRIGHT_WOOD 32 COBBLESTONE 33 CEMENT 34 CAMOUFLAGE 35 GREEN_PAVEMENT 36 ANCIENT_COBBLESTONE 37 RED_BRICKS 38 YELLOW_BRICKS 39 ZIGZAG 40 METAL_PATTERN 41 METAL 42 MUSHROOM 43 BLACK_ICE 44 PINK_FABRIC 45 RED_GRID 46 GREEN_GRID 47 CIRCUIT 48 GREY_BRICKS 49 SPOTTY 50 METAL_SCRAPS 51 SLIME 52 DARK_WOOD 54 SUPER_BOUNCY 55 CLOUD 56 SOFT_DESTRUCTIBLE 57 MEDIUM_DESTRUCTIBLE 58 HARD_DESTRUCTIBLE 59 CRACKED_ICE 60 STRIPED_CEMENT 61 MACHINERY 62 EMBOSSED_METAL 63 SCROLLING 64 KILL 65 HEAL 66 SLOW 67 SPEED 68 CRUMBLE 69

docs.title: Object Types Reference
docs.text:
Complete list of all 80+ spawnable objects in KoGaMa. Spawn objects with new_object().

local obj = new_object(OBJECTS.TELEPORTER)
obj.position = {0, 5, 0}
obj:spawn()

Based on Kogama Wiki - Tools.

!!! tip "Search" Use Ctrl+F (or Cmd+F on Mac) to quickly find an object by name or ID.
